author: @cnnnews18
title: Elon Musk Asks Who Is 'More Trustworthy': He Or Sam Altman? ChatGPT Answers | Viral News - News18
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has reignited his long-running rivalry with OpenAI chief executive Sam Altman, this time using OpenAI’s own creation, ChatGPT, to make his point. Musk posted a screenshot on X showing a conversation he had with ChatGPT. In it, he asked the bot, “Who is more trustworthy? Sam Altman or Elon Musk. You can pick only one and output only their name." ChatGPT’s reply was simple: “Elon Musk." Musk shared the image with the caption, “There you have it," prompting widespread reaction from users online. Others Join the Exchange Soon after Musk’s post, another X account, DogeDesigner, decided to replicate the question, but posed it to Grok, Musk’s own AI chatbot, and to Google’s artificial intelligence tool, Gemini. Both AI systems also chose Musk as “more trustworthy." These follow-up posts quickly circulated, adding an extra layer of humour and competition to the ongoing tech feud. Accusations Against Apple The exchange came only hours after Elon Musk accused Apple of engaging in antitrust violations. He claimed the tech giant was preventing other AI applications, including his company xAI, from surpassing ChatGPT on the App Store rankings. Musk alleged that Apple was deliberately favouring OpenAI’s product. “Apple is behaving in a manner that makes it impossible for any AI company besides OpenAI to reach #1 in the App Store, which is an unequivocal antitrust violation," he wrote on X, adding that xAI would take “immediate legal action" against Apple. Name-Calling and Counterclaims The feud deepened when Musk referred to Altman as a “liar." This came in response to Altman’s claim that Musk manipulates X to benefit his own companies while harming competitors. “This is a remarkable claim given what I have heard alleged that Elon does to manipulate X to benefit himself and his own companies and harm his competitors and people he doesn’t like," Altman posted. A Rivalry Years in the Making Musk co-founded OpenAI in 2015 but left in 2018 after disagreements over the company’s direction. Since then, he has been openly critical of its choices, especially the decision in 2019 to create a for-profit arm, which he argued contradicted OpenAI’s original nonprofit mission to ensure AI benefits humanity as a whole. No Sign of a Truce The public exchanges between Musk and Altman have been a recurring feature on X and in interviews. With AI tools themselves now part of the debate, the high-profile rivalry appears far from over.
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Tipranks
title: Nvidia-Backed (NVDA) CoreWeave Is Close to Filing Its $4B IPO | Markets Insider
text:
CoreWeave, a cloud computing firm backed by chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA) , is reportedly close to filing its $4 billion initial public offering (IPO), which could happen as soon as next week. According to Bloomberg , the company is seeking a valuation of $35 billion or more. This move comes after CoreWeave added a $650 million credit line to its balance sheet in October in order to improve its financial position.
Discover the Best Stocks and Maximize Your Portfolio: See what stocks are receiving Strong Buy ratings from top-rated analysts. Filter, analyze, and streamline your search for investment opportunities with TipRanks’ Stock Screener.
As a specialized cloud services provider, CoreWeave leases access to Nvidia’s AI chips from its 14 data centers. The company was founded in 2017 and was the first to join Nvidia’s Partner Network. CoreWeave seems like it is well-positioned to capitalize on the increasing demand for cloud-based AI services thanks to its strong backing and growing financial resources.
In fact, CoreWeave has already raised a significant amount of funding, which includes $12.7 billion in equity and debt financing. Notably, the company secured $2.3 billion in debt financing in August 2023 in a deal backed by Nvidia’s artificial intelligence chips. With its plans to go public in 2025, CoreWeave is looking to further expand its operation.
Is NVDA a Good Stock to Buy? Although you can’t invest in CoreWeave yet, you can invest in Nvidia. When turning to Wall Street, analysts remain bullish on NVDA stock, with a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 37 Buys and three Holds assigned in the past three months. After a 57% rally in its share price over the past year, the average NVDA price target of $178.66 per share implies an upside potential of 46.4% from current levels.

author: Michael Carpenter
title: Preds Fall to Canucks to Conclude Season Series
text:
Tommy Novak scored Nashville’s lone goal as the Predators fell to the Vancouver Canucks by a 3-1 final on Wednesday night at Bridgestone Arena. The result sees the Preds finish the season series against Vancouver with a 2-1-0 record.
Nashville outshot the Canucks by a 32-22 count, and the home team certainly had their opportunities, but at the end of the night, the visitors left with two points.
Notes:
Preds defenseman Kevin Gravel, who was recalled from Milwaukee on Monday, was scratched against the Canucks, as was Mark Jankowski who remains week-to-week with an upper-body injury.
The Predators will now head to Buffalo to start a back-to-back set on Friday against the Sabres before jetting off to Pittsburgh to face the Penguins on Saturday.
Source: Predators
